verbs.description: solodize (third-person singular simple present solodizes, present participle solodizing, simple past and past participle solodized)

entries.meaning: (soil science) To cause to become solodic.
examples: The vineyards in both Districts are on various duplex soils: red-brown earths, solodized-solonetz and solodic soils, yellow podzolic soils and soloths.
